strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_def>*: Hello! Can I help you? Oh! You're not <IF_SOLO>a customer<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>customers<ENDIF_SOLO>? Looking for someone, eh? Well, anyway, down to business.
<se_low>*: Huh? Lookin' for somethin', are ya? I dunno, no one seems to be buyin' anythin' lately.
<se_low>*: This is a weapon shop. No offence, but if you're not here to do business, you shouldn't be here at all!
<se_high>*: Zzz... Pity, pitizzz... Hmm...
<se_def>*: Ah ha ha! Looks like you're a bit lost there! That's the back door.
<se_def>*: Would you mind going round outside and coming in the proper entrance?

<se_def>*: Lost again, are you!?
I told you before, that's the back door!
<se_def>*: But I suppose I can make an exception and serve you from here, just this once.
<se_low>*: Hic! Just the one after work...really <endash> Hic! <endash> hits the spot! So, er...what d'ya want with me then?

<se_low>*: Eh? Have I got any info? Get out of here!
Why are you borin' me with that rubbish?

<se_low>*: This is a pub! Hic! You're supposed to relax!
If you're too tense, have a drink or let it all out on the battlefield!
<se_low>*: At least you can put your tension to good use out there! You know, if you psyche yourself up enough, your attacks and magic get more powerful.

<se_low>*: So save it for fightin', all right!?
Remember, increase your tension by psychin' up.
Decrease it by havin' a <endash> Hic! <endash> drink! Ha ha ha!
<se_low>*: Urrrgh...
<se_low>*: No more... No...more...drink!
<se_def>*: Aaaaah... I'm so sleepy!

<se_def>*: I'm sorry, <IF_MALE>sir<ELSE_NOT_MALE>miss<ENDIF_MALE>.
I've stopped serving for the night.
<se_low>*: I'm so bored!
<se_low>*: There's never anyone around to talk to at this time of day.
<se_low>*: If you hadn't come over for a chat, it would've been yet another dull old night.

<se_high>*: (Yawn) I'm worn out!
I've been on my feet all day!
<se_high>*: But it's so late already. I won't get a good night's sleep now. It's going to ruin my skin!

<se_def>*: This is just between you and me, all right?
I was planning on making a suit of metal king armour if I ever got hold of the alchemy pot.

<se_def>*: I've already found out the recipe.
Huh! Fat lot of good it'll do me now!
What a waste of time!
<se_low>*: Master Rylus could be a bit difficult at times, but he was a good man deep down.

<se_low>*: He had an apprentice, you know.
A haughty one, but completely useless at magic.
He was quite a handful.

<se_low>*: But Rylus was a strict teacher. He refused
to give up on that foolhardy young man.
He believed in him, you see.

<se_low>*: Come to think of it, I don't remember seeing the young fellow since Rylus passed away.
I wonder where he's got to...

<se_low>*: Hm? What was his name, you say? Well now,
I can't remember. It was a rather peculiar name.
Dhoul-something or other, I think.
<se_high>*: I wonder when they're going to repair the bridge to the west? It's been broken for ages now.
<se_high>*: Not that anyone in their right mind would want to go to the castle there given the state it's in now!
<se_def>*: I really wanted to make myself a suit of metal king armour. It's a crying shame I couldn't get hold of that alchemy pot.
<se_def>*: What? You want me to tell you the recipe?
<se_def>*: I don't think so! It may be useless to me now, but I went to a lot of trouble finding it out!
<se_def>*: I'm not just going to give it away to any old Tom, Dick or Harry!
<se_low>*: Oi! What d'you think you're doin' comin' in the back way like that!? The entrance is over there!
<se_low>*: Ha ha! You're new to this game, aren't ya?
<se_low>*: I knew it! How about I give you a few pointers to get you started?
<se_low>*: Listen. Havin' a load of weapons and armour knockin' about in your bag won't do you no good. You've gotta equip yourself with 'em!
<se_low>*: You're not? Well, I reckon I could still teach you a thing or two.

<se_low>*: How about this? When you come across
monsters that are weaker than you, you can
just intimidate 'em to save yourself a fight.

<se_low>*: Most of the time they'll just run away.
Did you know that?
<se_low>*: But if you try pullin' the same trick with stronger monsters, you'll soon know about it! You've gotta weigh up each monster carefully.
<se_def>*: What was it again? Liquid metal armour<...>crown<...>that hard wotsit<...>alchemy pot... (Mumble mumble)
<se_high>*: Welcome to Farebury.
<se_high>*: Oh, it's you again! Fancy coming to see Kalderasha at a time like this!

<se_high>*: I don't blame you, though. When you're
not sure how things are going to turn out,
it's always nice to have your fortune read.
<se_low>*: It was all nice an' peaceful for a bit, but now ev'ryfin's gone pear-shaped. It's a right mess.

<se_low>*: An' it's not just 'ere.
The 'ole world's in trouble.
<se_low>*: What's gonna 'appen to us all, eh?
<se_high>*: I went to Kalderasha to see if he could tell me what on earth is going on, but he was rather vague really.
<se_high>*: All he said was that there was nothing to worry about. He wouldn't tell me anything else at all. Now that's got me even more worried!
<se_high>*: (Purr purr)
<se_def>*: Coming in the back way, eh? Then you must be looking for something a little bit...‘special’.
<se_def>*: Hu hu hu! You won't be disappointed. No amount of trouble in the world's going to hold me back. I've prepared a special treat for you!
<se_def>*: I went to the Lord High Priest's funeral the other day, you know. Well, I was on business really.
<se_def>*: Anyway, I managed to hide a recipe there without anyone noticing!
<se_def>*: When you're next there, have a look around by the platform in the Ascension Way that leads up to the Lord High Priest's residence.<page>*: You're sure to find something interesting!

<se_def>*: What? You've already found the recipe?
Well, I can't compete with that!
It looks like I'm beaten!
<se_def>*: I don't have any more recipes to give you anyway, so I guess that's the end of this little game. Still, it was fun while it lasted!

<se_def>*: La la la la la ♪
Ooh I say, ooh I say,
I heard some news the other day!

<se_def>*: Ahem...
Seven great sages from times long past;
Their legacy in blood doth last... ♪

<se_def>*: But should that blood now be spilled,
And the sages' heritage unfulfilled,<page>*: A terrible fate awaits us all;
A fearful, dreadful...er...downfall! ♪
<se_def>*: Perhaps that terrible fate is what's happening to us all now.

<se_def>*: You'll never guess what!
People are saying that Neos has been destroyed!
<se_def>*: Seems it all started when some ruffians stormed the new Lord High Priest's initiation ceremony.
<se_def>*: I bet they were minions from the underworld! They probably saw Neos as a thorn in their side!
<se_def>*: Huh? It was you!?
<se_def>*: I-I'm sorry, I didn't mean...
<se_low>*: Oh! Are <IF_SOLO>you<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>you lot<ENDIF_SOLO> still travellin' about at a time like this!? You're either really brave or really stupid!
<se_low>*: I suppose you must have good reason if you're still battlin' on. Good luck! I hope it works out for ya!
<se_def>*: Things are going from bad to worse lately. There are a lot more monsters than there used to be, not to mention the sky burning red...
<se_def>*: I suppose it all started when Trodain Castle was destroyed and the southern checkpoint was breached.

<se_def>*: Maybe what's happening now is just the
start of an even bigger disaster. Goddess!
What's going to happen next!?
<se_low>*: Ever since the sky turned red, the atmosphere in town's been really tense. Everyone's on edge.
<se_low>*: It's at times like this that we really need a jester to come along and cheer us all up.
<se_low>*: Well, just as long as he wasn't like that scary one who was here a while back.

<se_high>*: Oh! It's you again.
What are you chasing after now?

<se_high>*: Oh! It's you again.
What are you chasing after now?
<se_high>*: Wow! A floating castle!?
<se_high>*: That sounds cool! You're so lucky!

<se_high>*: Wow! The Lord of Darkness!?
That sounds a bit serious!
<se_def>*: Be careful if you go out of the west gate. There's a really scary monster on the prowl north of there, on the way to the sea.

<se_def>*: I was out gathering herbs the other day,
and it chased me around all over the place.
It's a persistent beast!
<se_low>*: It's so scary. Scary, scary, scary...
<se_low>*: No, it doesn't really work. I thought I could adapt that jester's catch[-]phrase to fit in with current affairs, but it's no good. Pity!

<se_low>*: The rhythm's all wrong.
It's just too hard to say.
<se_high>*: Everyone's saying that the red sky signals the end of the world!

<se_high>*: But I'm not dying yet!
Not until I get to stand at the altar!
That's right! Not until I get to marry
<...>well, somebody!
<se_high>*: Maybe I'll marry a brave and handsome hero who comes along to save the world from disaster!

<se_high>*: In times of need, the door to the
church will never be closed to you.
Please, feel free to go inside.
<se_high>*: The new Lord High Priest may be missing, and Holy Isle of Neos may have been destroyed, but the Goddess never deserts us.
<se_high>*: It's at times like these, that we must all pray for Her mercy.
<se_high>*: Ever since the sky turned that menacing red colour, I've been hearing all sorts of scary rumours. I don't know what to believe.
<se_high>*: Someone told me the Holy Isle of Neos had been destroyed, and someone else said they saw a giant castle floating in the sky!
<se_high>*: Even the Great Kalderasha doesn't seem to be able to shed any light on things.
<se_high>*: Everyone's been asking him the same questions, but he just doesn't seem to have any answers.

<se_high>*: Or maybe he's seen something so terrible,
he doesn't know how to tell us...?

<se_high>*: Ooooh. I wish I hadn't thought of that.
I've gone and scared myself now!

<se_low>*: First Trodain Castle and now the Holy Isle
of Neos! Both of them in ruins, they say!
I'm flabbergasted!

<se_low>*: I once went on a pilgrimage to Neos,
you know. A long time ago now, mind you.
<se_low>*: It's home to the most incredible statue of the Goddess you ever did see.

<se_low>*: But she's gone now, I suppose.
It's such a tragedy.

<se_low>*: It was over to the west in the middle of
the night! I saw it with my own eyes!
A huge castle...floating in the sky!

<se_low>*: How on earth could something so big fly!?
It doesn't even have wings!
<se_low>*: People say it's magic, but can you imagine how powerful the enchantment would have to be to make something as big as that fly!?
<se_low>*: If that's the castle of this Lord of Darkness I keep hearing about, I'd say we're all in trouble. Big trouble!

<se_low>*: I mean, how would we even stand a chance against a floating castle, when it's so BIG and HUGE and FLYING and EVERYTHING!!!<page>*: And, well, it's not as if people can fly, is it, and...even if they...I mean it's just so...I mean...
even if...
<se_low>*: Hahh, hahh, urrgh...ahem!

<se_low>*: Sorry, throat's a bit dry.
I was talking too much.
Got a bit worked up.
<se_low>*: But you've got to talk, eh? Nothing better than having a chat! Although it does get me into trouble sometimes! Heh heh heh!
<se_low>*: When you get to my age, dear, these things don't scare you much any more. I know my time's nearly up.
<se_low>*: But I can see everyone's rather disturbed since the sky turned red like that. I thought it was rather pretty myself!
<se_low>*: Still, all I pray for is that we have peace in the world.
<se_low>*: Kalderasha is very cautious about his fortune-telling these days.

<se_low>*: He won't tell anyone what he can see in
his crystal ball about this latest calamity.
Still, I suppose he has our best interests at heart.
<se_low>*: He wouldn't want to inadvertently cause any more misery. The death of Valentina's father must still play on his mind.
<se_low>*: Of course, he'd never admit it to anyone.
<se_high>*: I can't take a break from the cleaning.
<se_high>*: It wouldn't do to neglect the housework, whether the world's coming to an end or not!

<se_high>*: I mean, we're talking about a clean house, here! And really, what's more important than that?<page>*: If the world were to end with the house in a mess...!? Well! I just couldn't live with myself!

<se_low>*: I was inside when the sky turned red,
so I didn't see it myself.

<se_low>*: Aaaah, what a shame.
It doesn't scare me, you know.
I'm well aware my days are numbered.

<se_low>*: I just wish I could have seen it happen.
It's a once in a lifetime thing, that.
And mine'll be over before long.
<se_def>*: I know everyone needs a drink at times like these. Even during the day.
<se_def>*: But I'm afraid I don't start serving until the evening. I'll have to ask you to come back then.
<se_high>*: Sorry. We don't serve drinks during the day.

<se_high>*: Oh, you've got Munchie with you again!
How are you, little Munchie-wunchie!?
You're so cute! ♪
<se_high>*: You've had that little mouse for ages now, haven't you? Do mice normally live that long?
<se_high>Valentina: Oh! You're back, <leader>!
<se_high>Valentina: Ever since the sky turned red, there's been a never-ending queue of people come to ask Father what it's all about.
<se_high>Valentina: But he just tells them all that everything's fine. He won't say any more than that, but that just seems to make everyone worry more!
<se_high>Valentina: Why don't you ask him, <leader>!?
<se_high>Valentina: I'm sure he'll tell YOU the truth.
<se_high>Valentina: It's because this Lord of Darkness, Rhapthorne has come back to life that all these strange things are happening now, isn't it?
<se_high>Valentina: But I suppose there'd be a mass panic if everyone knew that.
<se_high>Valentina: That's why Father's not telling people what he can see in his crystal ball. He's thinking of them, you see. I finally understand now.
<se_low>Kalderasha: At last! I have been waiting for you.

<se_low>Kalderasha: I saw you in battle with the Lord of Darkness, Rhapthorne. Yeeesss, I saw it in the crystal.
He is at the root of this catastrophe.
<se_low>Kalderasha: And now, before your final encounter with him, you wish me to look into the crystal once again to reveal the outcome of the battle?
<se_low>Kalderasha: Even the Great Kalderasha cannot see such things!
<se_low>Kalderasha: Rhapthorne is shrouded in mist. I see only mist in the mists! Even my eyes cannot penetrate their hidden mysteries.
<se_low>Kalderasha: But I know you have what it takes, <leader>! You can do what needs to be done!
<se_low>Kalderasha: Hmph. I sense you were hoping for something more helpful from the Great Kalderasha. Well...fortune be with you!
<se_low>Kalderasha: Even I cannot foresee the outcome of your final battle with the Lord of Darkness.
<se_low>Kalderasha: He is shrouded in mist. I see only mist in the mists! Even my eyes cannot penetrate their hidden mysteries.
<se_low>Kalderasha: But I know you have what it takes, <leader>! You can do what needs to be done!
<se_low>Kalderasha: Hmph. I sense you were hoping for something more helpful from the Great Kalderasha. Well...fortune be with you!
<se_def>*: I know there's a bit of a panic at the moment, but I'm thinking of leaving the gate open at night.

<se_def>*: I mean, nothing's actually happened, has it?
I don't want to inconvenience people like when we had that fire.

<se_low>*: Fire is a fearsome thing.
Devours everything in its path.

<se_low>*: When the sky turned red the other day,
I was afraid some almighty blaze had started
up somewhere.
<se_low>*: But a fire that big would have destroyed the whole world by now.
<se_low>*: Oh, yes! It's a fearsome thing. You can never be too careful with fire, you know.
<se_low>*: That's the stuff! Ice-cold water's just wot ya need after you've 'ad a few too many!
<se_low>*: So, are <IF_SOLO>you<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>you lot<ENDIF_SOLO> still chasin' someone, then?

<se_low>*: Yer really somefin'!
I've got to 'and it to ya, ya don't give up easy, eh!
<se_high>*: There are so many worrying rumours flying about at the moment.<page>*: Thinking about it, it all started at about the time that castle over in the west fell into ruin.
<se_high>*: Master Rylus passed away just after that, didn't he?
<se_high>*: It's horrible to think that all this trouble in the world started so close to home.
<se_low>*: I expect you've heard the rumours. Ever since the sky turned red, people have been saying there's some terrifying new evil in the world.
<se_low>*: It's just as I feared. All this has happened because Rylus was killed and the sage's bloodline ended.
<se_low>*: Oh, Goddess on high! Have mercy on us all! Save us from disaster!
<se_high>*: I'm so busy! I don't care what's going on the world, there's no excuse for neglecting the housework!

<se_high>*: I suppose you're looking for my husband?
He's just there.
<se_def>*: I don't know, I've had the jitters ever since I saw that blood-red sky. Come evening, I can't relax at all.

<se_def>*: I seem to end up in the pub every night.
I can't get to sleep unless I've had a few.
<se_low>*: You'd have thought the Great Kalderasha would know what all these strange goings-on were about.
<se_low>*: Hmph! I really believed the miserable old layabout was taking things a bit more seriously these days! But no, he's just as spiritless as ever.
<se_low>*: Back to his old ways. People never change, believe you me. He's a sorry excuse for a man, that wastrel!
<se_low>*: I saw it with my own eyes! An enormous flying castle off in the western sky in the middle of the night!

<se_low>*: How can anything that big fly?
It's not even as if it had wings!
<se_low>*: Some people think it's magic, but there's no magic powerful enough to make something that huge fly!
<se_low>*: Besides, if it is the Lord of Darkness's castle like people are saying, we're all done for! Doomed, if you ask me!

<se_low>*: I mean, how in the Goddess's name are we supposed to fight something like that!?!
It's not as if we can fly, is it!?<page>*: And even if we had a long enough ladder, what would we do then!? Chip away at the mortar!?<page>*: Throw stones at the windows!? Push a sternly...hahh...worded...hahh...note under the door...
<se_low>*: Hahh, hahh, urrgh...ahem!

<se_low>*: Sorry, just had to catch my breath!
Been talking so much.
Phew, I could do with a drink!

<se_low>*: Ah, you can't beat a good chat, can you!?
I love it. It's got me into trouble a fair few times, mind you! Heh heh!

<se_high>*: You'll always get a warm welcome here.
Enjoy <IF_SOLO>yourself<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>yourselves<ENDIF_SOLO>!

<se_high>*: Hey, isn't that your little pet, Munchie!?
Good evening, Mister Munchie!
Tee hee, you're so cute! ♪
<se_high>*: You've had that little mouse for ages now, haven't you? Do mice normally live that long?
<se_def>*: Oh dear! Sorry, <IF_MALE>sir<ELSE_NOT_MALE>miss<ENDIF_MALE>, but I'm afraid customers aren't allowed behind the bar.
<se_def>*: You'll have to go round and come in through the main entrance if you want a drink.
<se_def>*: So, <IF_MALE>sir<ELSE_NOT_MALE>miss<ENDIF_MALE>! What do you think of all this flying castle talk then, eh?
<se_def>*: A bit hard to believe, wouldn't you say?
<se_def>*: One of my customers over there is adamant they saw it, though. I'm sure you'll hear all about it before long!
<se_def>*: Aaaah...phew...
<se_def>*: ...Hah!? Oops! Can't afford to doze off at times like these. Can't afford to let down our guard!
<se_def>*: Thanks for coming over.

<se_def>*: These are very dangerous times.
I've got a responsibility to protect the town.
No time for dozing off!

<se_low>*: What the<endash>!? Don't creep up on me like that!
I thought you were gonna rob me or something!
<se_low>*: With all this crazy stuff goin' on in the world, I half expected someone to try and pull a fast one.
<se_low>*: But if they do, I'll be ready for 'em! I'll make 'em wish they'd never even thought of it!
<se_low>*: Hu hu, I can hardly wait!
<se_def>*: We carried out a very thorough investigation, but we never managed to track down the criminal who broke through the southern checkpoint.
<se_def>*: I don't know. Monsters are on the increase, too. The whole world's going to the dogs if you ask me.

<se_high>*: Welcome to The Weary Wanderer!
Farebury's oldest inn!
<se_high>*: I'm here to make your travels more comfortable and explain a few things.

<se_high>*: Any seasoned traveller would know it already, of course. But if you've only just set out,
it might be useful. Would you like to hear it?
<se_high>*: That's fine. I just thought maybe you hadn't done much travelling before and I wanted to help...
<se_high>*: The A button is really useful. It lets you do a whole range of things, like chat to people and pick up or examine objects.

<se_high>*: You can examine everything in this room just using that one button.<page>*: The wardrobes, the sacks on the wall,
the treasure chest, the bookshelves, everything!

<se_high>*: Feel free to take anything you like.
It's all there for the customers.
<se_high>*: Oh, and holding down the L and R buttons together briefly lets you look at things through your own eyes. Press the A, B, X or Y button to switch back again.
<se_high>*: It's really useful when you want to examine things that are very close to you, or if you want to look down at the ground or up into the sky.
<se_high>*: And, er...that's about everything I can tell you, I think.
<se_high>*: There's lots more to learn, but I'm sure you'll work it out for yourself along the way.
<se_high>*: Don't forget that really useful button I told you about at the beginning! And enjoy your travels!

<se_low>Kalderasha: ...So, you know about the Monster Arena, hm?
Remember, the Great Kalderasha sees all!
You cannot hide things from my eyes.
<se_low>Kalderasha: Sometimes it may be...advantageous to empty your mind of your quest, and take part in this ‘sport’.
<se_low>Kalderasha: Do well in the arena, and you will find people are drawn to your success. One man could be so drawn, he may even wish to join your...wagon quest, perhaps?
<se_low>Kalderasha: .........

<se_low>Kalderasha: By the way, as I was clearing the mists in my
search for information about Rhapthorne,
I saw something. Neos, as it is, in ruins.

<se_low>Kalderasha: I am perhaps mistaken, but I have a strong
feeling there is more awaiting you on the
Holy Isle.

<se_low>Kalderasha: But who am I to say, hm?
I tell you only what I see in my crystal ball.
Perhaps my fortune-telling is just...haphazard!
